definition: to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa

sentences.english: Be strict to oneself , be more tolerant to others .
sentences.chinese: 严于律己，更要宽以待人。

sentences.english: Love the people, strict in request the oneself, serve society, create the brilliancy together.
sentences.chinese: 爱民，严于律己，服务社会，共创辉煌。

sentences.english: "Tolerate to others, discipline myself" was also a teaching from him.
sentences.chinese: “与人为善，严于律己”是祖父教导的家训。

sentences.english: Self-disciplined, disciplines students well, has strong responsibility, friendly to students.
sentences.chinese: 教师能够严于律己，教风严谨，责任心强，态度友好。

sentences.english: The word "Self-denial" means restraining being strict with oneself.
sentences.chinese: “自我否定”一词意味着严于律己。

sentences.english: Disciplined senior manager with superior customer penetrating and priority development capabilities;
sentences.chinese: 严于律己，且有丰富的重点客户开发及渗透的能力。

definition: to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
to set an example (idiom); to serve as a model
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
to guard against pride and impatience (idiom); to remain modest and keep cool
